intro: Papuacalia ottoensis, commonly known as Otto's papuacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lanceolate, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
